cyber-dojo.sh:
rm -f *.class
CLASSES=.:`ls /cucumber/*.jar | tr '\n' ':'`
javac -Xlint:unchecked -cp $CLASSES  *.java
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  java -cp $CLASSES org.junit.runner.JUnitCore `ls -1 *Test*.class | grep -v '\\$' | sed 's/\(.*\)\..*/\1/'`
fi
hear_shout.feature:
Feature: Hearing a shout

    Shouts have a range of approximately 1000 metres
      Background:
        Given Lucy is at 0, 0
        
      Scenario: Multiple shouters
        Given people are locate at
            | name      | x     | y     |
            | Sean      | 0     | 500   |
            | Oscar     | 1100  | 0     |
        When Sean shouts
        And Oscar shouts
        Then Lucy should not hear Oscar
        But Lucy should hear Sean
        
       Scenario: Shouters should not hear their own shouts 
        When Lucy shouts
        Then Lucy should not hear Lucy
        
       Scenario Outline: only hear in-range shouts
        And Sean is at <Seans-location>
        When Sean shouts 
        Then Lucy should hear <what-Lucy-hears>
        
        Examples: some simple examples
            |Seans-location | what-Lucy-hears |
            |0, 900         | Sean            |
            |800, 800       | nothing         |
            
       Scenario: Multiple shouts from one person
        And Sean is at 0, 500
        When Sean shouts 
        And Sean shouts
        Then Lucy should hear 2 shouts from Sean

dnd.feature:
Feature: Do not disturb
    When DND is on, no shouts should be shown, 
    if its off and certain hashtags are specified, 
    it shouldnt show those either.
    
    Background:
        Given Lucy is at 0, 0
        Given Oscar is at 0, 0
        Given Sean is at 0, 0
        
    Scenario: DND is turned on
        Given Lucy has enabled DND
        When Sean shouts
        And Oscar shouts
        Then Lucy should not see any shouts
        
    Scenario: DND hastags are specified
        Given Lucy has disabled DND
        And Lucy has specified "#coffee"
        When Sean sends shout "#coffee"
        And Oscar sends shout "#donuts"
        Then Lucy should only see "#donuts" from Oscar
        
    Scenario: DND hastags are specified
        Given Lucy has disabled DND
        And Lucy has specified "#coffee"
        And Lucy has specified "#donuts"
        When Lucy has unblocked "#donuts"
        And Sean sends shout "#coffee"
        And Oscar sends shout "#donuts"
        Then Lucy should only see "#donuts" from Oscar
